column1: Master of Health Science in International Healthcare Management (Intentional Stream)
column5: This exciting full-time Masters programme has been developed as a response to an identified need in international healthcare for a postgraduate programme which focuses on health care management. The purpose of the Master of Health Science in International Healthcare Management is to prepare healthcare professionals to assume the role of managers/leaders in various health care settings globally.Location: ATU St Angela'sProgramme OutlineThe MHSc comprises of 7 modules. The modular programme will be delivered full-time over one calendar year and is worth 90
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
